text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Obock Region | native_name = | settlement_type = Region (Gobolka - Rakaakay) | nickname = | motto = | image_skyline = Obock Region landscape.jpg | image_map = Djibouti - Obock.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = | pushpin_label_position = | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = | coordinates = | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat_type = Administrative centre | seat = Obock | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 4,700 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | area_water_percent = | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 44,678 | population_as_of = 2019 | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = DJ-OB | website = | footnotes = }} The Obock Region is a region in northern Djibouti. The administrative centre is Obock. Other towns are: Khôr ‘Angar, Alaili Dadda`, and Medeho. It is bordered by Eritrea to the north, the Tadjourah Region to the southwest, and the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden to the east. There are several salt-lakes on the road to Tadjoura. ==References== Category:Regions of Djibouti
title: Obock Region
